Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive Teradata-to-Snowflake conversion reviews with similar analytical depth. Ascendion_AVA+ focuses on business logic preservation and optimization suggestions, while DI_Teradata_To_Snowflake_Reviewer emphasizes orchestration requirements and cost efficiency. Both identify key conversion challenges including session management, error handling, and Snowflake-specific optimizations.

Both outputs address the same core conversion task with aligned understanding of Teradata-to-Snowflake migration challenges. Key semantic alignment includes: table creation accuracy, join logic preservation, session management limitations, and optimization needs. Minor divergence in emphasis - Ascendion_AVA+ focuses more on business logic preservation while DI_Teradata_To_Snowflake_Reviewer emphasizes orchestration requirements.

Both outputs follow nearly identical structural organization: Summary, Conversion Accuracy, Discrepancies/Issues, Optimization Suggestions, Overall Assessment, Recommendations, and API Cost Analysis. Section ordering and logical flow are consistent. Minor structural differences in metadata format and subsection emphasis.

Proper metadata format with complete header structure. All technical details are accurate including data type mappings, join logic analysis, and Snowflake limitations. Minor formatting inconsistency in bullet points.

Metadata format differs from specified requirements but content is accurate. Technical analysis is sound with correct identification of conversion challenges. Some inconsistency in data type discussion (CHAR vs VARCHAR).
Average of individual correctness scores. Both outputs demonstrate high technical accuracy with minor formatting and consistency issues.
